meanings.definition: To transport or be transported instantaneously from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The magician teleported from the stage to the audience in a blink of an eye.
meanings.sent2: The superhero teleported to the top of the building to save the day.
meanings.sent3: The cat teleported from the couch to the kitchen, surprising its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind teleported back to the happy memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship teleported through the galaxy at the speed of light.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or being moved in this way.
meanings.sent1: The sudden teleportation of the object amazed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The teleportation of the characters in the movie added an exciting twist to the plot.
meanings.sent3: The teleportation of the cake from the kitchen to the living room puzzled the guests.
meanings.sent4: The teleportation of ideas from one mind to another is a fascinating concept.
meanings.sent5: The teleportation of sound waves through the air is a key principle in communication.
